item.title: 'Pitch Perfect 3' release moved up
item.description: Fans can get ready for an aca-awesome time earlier than expected.

'Pitch Perfect 3' release moved up Updated 1538 GMT (2338 HKT) May 10, 2016 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film Elizabeth Banks will direct the third installment of "Pitch Perfect" whose release date has been moved up to July 2017 from August, Variety reported. Hide Caption 1 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film Fans of "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" have a bit of a wait for the sequel. "Star Wars: Episode VIII" isn't due to be released until December 15, 2017. Hide Caption 2 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film The "X-Men" franchise was revived with 2011's "X-Men: First Class" and 2014's "X-Men: Days of Future Past." Now we can look forward to "X-Men: Apocalypse," which is scheduled for May, along with another "Captain America" installment, "Captain America: Civil War." Hide Caption 3 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film Director Roland Emmerich tweeted that Vivica A. Fox will reprise her role as Jasmine Dubrow in "Independence Day 2," the sequel to the hit 1996 film. Also starring Liam Hemsworth and original cast member Jeff Goldblum, the film is slated to open on June 24. Hide Caption 4 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film The last time we saw Eddie Murphy as Detective Axel Foley, it was in 1994's "Beverly Hills Cop III." But the passage of time is nothing to a movie studio eager to bet on a proven franchise; "Beverly Hills Cop 4," again starring Murphy as Foley, is in the works. Hide Caption 5 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film Johnny Depp returns as the Mad Hatter in the long-awaited followup to 2010's "Alice in Wonderland." This 2016 release is called "Alice in Wonderland: Through the Looking Glass." Hide Caption 6 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film Michael Bay's 2014 take on "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" suffered some criticism but did well enough at the box office to make a sequel an obvious choice. Reporter April and her four turtle friends will return to theaters on June 3. Hide Caption 7 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film When it comes to sequels, few have been as longed for as "Finding Dory," the next installment following Disney/Pixar's heartwarming 2003 film, "Finding Nemo." It's due to arrive in theaters June 17. Hide Caption 8 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film Eddie Redmayne stars as magician Newt Scamander in "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them," a prequel to the Harry Potter series. The movie opens November 18. Hide Caption 9 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film Marvel's "Guardians of the Galaxy" was going to be either a complete disaster or a big hit; lucky for us, it was the latter. Following the August 2014 release's insane run at the box office, Marvel is planning to deliver a second "Guardians" on May 5, 2017. Hide Caption 10 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film "Rise of the Planet of the Apes" was a pleasant surprise in 2011, and 2014's sequel, "Dawn of the Planet of the Apes," was considered one of the best releases of the summer. All of that means the still untitled third installment, "War for the Planet of the Apes" due July 14, 2017, has a lot to live up to. Also arriving that month will be another "Bourne" installment, as well as "Ice Age 5." Hide Caption 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film The third "How to Train Your Dragon" animated movie is due out in summer 2017. Hide Caption 12 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film At this point, Johnny Depp might want to consider making his eyeliner permanent. The actor is stepping into Captain Jack Sparrow's costume once again for the fifth "Pirates of the Caribbean" film, subtitled "Dead Men Tell No Tales." It's scheduled for July 2017. Hide Caption 13 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film Comic-book Thor may now be a woman, but at the movies, Chris Hemsworth is still wielding the hero's hammer. Following "Thor" and "Thor: The Dark World," the third installment, "Thor: Ragnarok," is slated for July 28, 2017. Hide Caption 14 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film The penguins from Dreamworks' "Madagascar" films have turned into breakout stars. The scheming seabirds had a movie all of their own called "Penguins of Madagascar." In 2018, we'll also get a fourth installment of the "Madagascar" series. Hide Caption 15 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film Marvel already has two more "Avengers" movies on the calendar: "Avengers: Infinity War Part I" opens May 2018, followed by "Avengers: Infinity War Part 2" in May 2019. (Not to mention "Captain America: Civil War" on May 6, 2016.) Hide Caption 16 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film Fans will have to wait till June 2019 for "The Incredibles 2," with "Cars 3" coming in June 2017 and "Toy Story 4" in June 2018. "Anytime you dedicate another couple of hours of screen time, you'll hopefully expand the world (of 'The Incredibles') a bit," said director Brad Bird. "It's fun for me to pick up the same characters and do new things with them. I'm enjoying it." Hide Caption 17 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film A new and improved Godzilla stormed into theaters in May 2014, and in 2018, we'll get a second look at the fearsome monster. That's just the beginning, though, with "Godzilla vs. King Kong" in 2020. Hide Caption 18 of 19 19 photos: Sequel mania: A guide to the next few years of film It's been a while, but James Cameron is finally making a return to Pandora in December 2018 with "Avatar 2." The followup to the 2009 blockbuster will be followed by more sequels in 2020, 2022 and 2023. "It's going to be a true epic saga," Cameron said. Here's a look at some other high-profile upcoming releases that continue popular movie franchises. Hide Caption
